Spiced Thai-Style Iced Tea Concentrate

Servings: Makes about 3 cups concentrate

Time: 15 minutes, plus 35 minutes steeping and cooling

Ingredients

  • 7 Assam tea bags
  • 1 cinnamon stick
  • 1 star anise pod
  • 1 teaspoon ground turmeric
  • 3 cups boiling water
  • ⅓ cup sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 tablespoon sugar
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Equipment

  • Best Electric Kettles
  • Fine-Mesh Strainers

Recipe Notes

  1. We strongly prefer the robust flavor and striking, amber-red color of Assam tea for this recipe, but you can substitute English breakfast tea if Assam is unavailable. For an accurate measurement of boiling water, bring a kettle of water to a boil and then measure out the desired amount.

Instructions

  1.  Place tea bags, cinnamon stick, star anise, and turmeric in bowl. Add boiling water and steep for 15 minutes. Strain mixture through fine-mesh strainer lined with triple layer of cheesecloth into second bowl. Stir in condensed milk, sugar, and vanilla. Let cool completely. (Concentrate can be refrigerated for up to 4 days.)
  2. TO SERVE: Pour ⅔ cup concentrate and ⅓ cup milk over ice into glass. (Sweeten with extra sugar if desired.) Stir to combine.
